poem:
### Across the Headlines

In the mosaic of mornings,  
protest swells like a river—  
people flood streets,  
lifting voices skyward.  
  
The calendar becomes a chorus,  
not of countdowns,  
but continuations,  
each step echoing  
in echoing chambers,  
while peace remains  
a distant country,  
still unnamed.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How Gaza sparked the biggest UK protest movement in recent history – and a headache for the police When the Palestine Solidarity Campaign organised its first protest against Israel’s bombing campaign in Gaza, days after Hamas’ deadly terror attacks on 7 October 2023, leaders expected the conflict to be over within weeks. “I remember saying to my staff ‘we are probably going to need to be responding to this through marches until potentially Christmas’,” recalls". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
